item.title: Start Breaking My Heart
item.description: high level intro do you like D&D (folk tradition) but not D&D (published rules) or D&D (play culture) or D&D (lifestyle brand)? does changing the name of the game cause shifts in your players’ behavior or your own? maybe you just like looking at different games for fun and stealing the bits you like. here are cool games you might want to check out games which belong in the NSR cauldron’s #modern-dnd channel.

item.title: Slappers Only!
item.description: Original Doc by deldon. Text has been edited by Window Dump. This is a curated collection of the official optional rules in D&D 2014 (aka 5e ‘14) culled from the DMG and PHB to create a simpler, more streamlined game. These rules should be compatible with many other similar games including D&D 2024 (5e ‘24), Tales of the Valiant, and Level Up!: Advanced 5e. Editorial editions Additions to the original text are in these helpful admonition boxes.

item.title: You can fix 5e!
item.description: Let’s start with some background – I’ve taken a somewhat unusual route to arrive here. Technically, the first RPG I was exposed to was D&D 3E, but the first RPG I actually read and fell in love with was Risus. Note that Risus has a drastically different approach to mechanics and style compared to other traditional RPG’s: it’s a rules-light comedy game. Despite almost zero experience with running games, I printed out its six pages and had an incredible session on a camping trip with crazy, collaborative worldbuilding.

item.title: I Don't Like 5e
item.description: Wow, random dweeb on the internet from a subculture resents the largest and most popular aspect of his subculture that’s acknowledged in mainstream media. What’s next, an essay about how drum & bass ruined jungle? Let’s start by placing all of the issues with Hasbro and Wizards of the Coast into a box labeled “art under capitalism” and move the box out of the scope of this post. No complaints about online-only, subscription-based content: I’ll engage with the designers in good faith that they just wanted to make another cool RPG.
